title: Even Eateries Feel Bite of Trade Wars, Wall Street Takes Issue with ‘Chaos Trades’, Trudeau Fights for His Political Life
itunes:title: Even Eateries Feel Bite of Trade Wars, Wall Street Takes Issue with ‘Chaos Trades’, Trudeau Fights for His Political Life
description:
Bloomberg News U.S. Senior Trade Editor Sarah McGregor talks about the impact of latest Trump trade tariffs on French wine, Italian cheese, Spanish olives and Scotch whiskies and more. Sarah Ponczek, Bloomberg News Cross-Asset Reporter, explains why analysts and investors are mostly skeptical of a Vanity Fair article titled “The Fantastically Profitable Mystery of the Trump Chaos Trades” that raises the possibility traders got more than lucky buying S&P 500 futures right before big market swings. Bloomberg Businessweek Editor Joel Weber and Bloomberg News Senior Writer Ethan Bronner discuss the challenges Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau faces in his bid for reelection on Oct. 21. Dimitri Sirota, CEO at BigID, shares his thoughts on data privacy and tech regulation. And we Drive to the Close with Jeff Kravetz, Regional Investment Director at U.S. Bank Wealth Management.

Hosts: Jason Kelly and Taylor Riggs. Producer: Paul Brennan. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
